supporting_text: The NAP outlines a One Health approach that integrates human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP includes specific strategies aimed at improving human health outcomes related to AMR.
The NAP addresses animal health through targeted actions to reduce AMR in livestock.
The NAP includes strategies to address environmental factors contributing to AMR.
The NAP outlines actions to ensure food security while managing AMR risks in agriculture.
The NAP specifies the establishment of a monitoring and evaluation framework for progress reporting.
The NAP sets specific timelines for achieving its outlined objectives.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and monitoring antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines budgetary allocations for various AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for AMR activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral task force to coordinate AMR efforts.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen legislation regarding antimicrobial use.
The NAP emphasizes training and educational initiatives to raise awareness about AMR.
The NAP outlines public awareness campaigns to engage communities in combating AMR.
The NAP highlights the importance of international collaboration for AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes strategies for enhancing data collection and surveillance systems for AMR.
The NAP outlines actions to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance.
The NAP includes specific strategies for sanitation and infection prevention.
The NAP emphasizes adherence to international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP mandates the rational use of antibiotics through specific regulations.
The NAP encourages participation in international research collaborations for AMR.
